MGSurvE.auxiliary module¶

MGSurvE.auxiliary.isNotebook()¶

Checks if the script is running from a Jupyter environment.

Returns

Flags Jupyter environment.

Return type

bool

MGSurvE.colors.colorPaletteFromHexList(clist)¶

MGSurvE.constants module¶

MGSurvE.kernels module¶

MGSurvE.kernels.truncatedExponential(distance, params=[0.01848777, 1e-10, inf])¶
Calculates the zero-inflated exponential for the mosquito movement kernel

(default parameters set to Aedes aegypti calibrations). params = [rate, a, b]

MGSurvE.kernels.zeroInflatedExponentialKernel(distMat, params=[0.01848777, 1e-10, inf], zeroInflation=0.75)¶
Calculates the migration matrix using a zero-inflated exponential function

taking as arguments the species-specific lifespan parameters, and the kernel constants (along with the lifelong stay probability).

MGSurvE.kernels.zeroInflatedLinearMigrationKernel(distMat, params=[0.75, 1])¶
Takes in the distances matrix, zero inflated value (step) and two extra

parameters to determine the change from distances into distance-based migration probabilities (based on the kernel function provided).

MGSurvE.landscape module¶

class MGSurvE.landscape.Landscape(points, maskingMatrix=None, distanceMatrix=None, distanceFunction=<built-in function dist>, migrationMatrix=None, kernelFunction=<function zeroInflatedExponentialKernel>, kernelParams={'params': [0.01848777, 1e-10, inf], 'zeroInflation': 0.75}, maskedMigrationMatrix=None)¶

Bases: object

Stores the information for a mosquito landscape. Works with different point-types in the form of matrices and coordinates.

points¶

Sites coordinates in (x, y) or (lon, lat) format.

Type

pandas dataframe

pointTypes¶

Sites types in the same order and length as the points coordinates.

Type

numpy array

pointsNumber¶

Number of sites present in the environment.

Type

int

distanceMatrix¶

Matrix with the distances between all the points in the landscape.

Type

numpy array

migrationMatrix¶

Markov matrix that determines the probability of moving from one site to another.

Type

numpy array

maskedMigrationMatrix¶

Markov matrix that biases migration probabilities as dictated by the masking matrix.

Type

numpy array

kernelFunction¶

Function that determines de relationship between distances and migration probabilities.

Type

function

kernelParams¶

Parameters required for the kernel function to determine migration probabilities.

Type

dict

maskingMatrix¶

Matrix that determines the probability of shifting from one point-type to another one (squared with size equal to the number of point types)

Type

numpy array

calcPointsDistances()¶

Calculates the distance matrix between the points in the landscape (in place).

calcPointsMigration()¶

Calculates the migration matrix between the points in the landscape based on distance alone (in place).

calcPointsMaskedMigration()¶

Calculates the migration matrix that takes into account the point-types of the sites (in place).

calcPointsDistances()¶

Test

calcPointsMaskedMigration()¶
calcPointsMigration()¶

MGSurvE.matrices.calcMaskedMigrationMatrix(migrationMatrix, maskingMatrix, pointTypes, distFun=<built-in function dist>)¶
